trans-unit.source: Represents the exclusive C14N XML canonicalization transform for a digital signature as defined by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C), without comments.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform> class represents the exclusive C14N XML canonicalization transform without comments.
This class is similar to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigC14NTransform> class, which allows a signer to create a digest using the canonical form of an XML document.
However, the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform> class excludes ancestor context from a canonicalized subdocument.
Use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigC14NTransform> class when you need to canonicalize an XML subdocument so that it is independent from its XML context.
For example, applications such as Web services that use signed XML within complex communication protocols often need to canonicalize XML in this manner.
Such applications often envelop XML within various dynamically constructed elements, which can substantially change the document and cause XML signature verification to fail.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform> class solves this problem by excluding such ancestor context from the canonical subdocument.
Typically, you do not create a new instance of a canonicalization transform class.

To specify a canonicalization transform, pass the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that describes a transform to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.CanonicalizationMethod%2A> property, which is accessible from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml.SignedInfo%2A> property.

To acquire a reference to the canonicalization transform, use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedInfo.CanonicalizationMethodObject%2A> property, which is accessible from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml.SignedInfo%2A> property.
You are required to create a new instance of a canonicalization transform class only when you want to manually hash an XML document or use your own canonicalization algorithm.

The URI that describes the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NWithCommentsTransform> class is defined by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml.XmlDsigExcC14NWithCommentsTransformUrl> field.
The URI that describes the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform> class is defined by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransformUrl> field.
For more information about the exclusive C14N transform, see the XMLDSIG specification, which is available from the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/.
The canonicalization algorithm is defined in the W3C Canonical XML specification, which is available at www.w3.org/2001/10/xml-exc-c14n.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> class specifying a value that determines whether to include comments.
`true` to include comments; otherwise, `false`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> class specifying a list of namespace prefixes to canonicalize using the standard canonicalization algorithm.

The `inclusiveNamespacesPrefixList` parameter contains a whitespace-delimited list of namespace prefixes to canonicalize using the standard canonicalization algorithm rather than the exclusive canonicalization algorithm.
To specify the default namespace, which does not have a prefix, pass the special prefix "#default".
The namespace prefixes to canonicalize using the standard canonicalization algorithm.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> class specifying whether to include comments, and specifying a list of namespace prefixes.

The `inclusiveNamespacesPrefixList` parameter contains a whitespace-delimited list of namespace prefixes to canonicalize using the standard canonicalization algorithm rather than the exclusive canonicalization algorithm.
To specify the default namespace, which does not have a prefix, pass the special prefix "#default".
`true` to include comments; otherwise, `false`.
The namespace prefixes to canonicalize using the standard canonicalization algorithm.
Returns the digest associated with a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm"></xref> object used to create a digest.
The digest associated with a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object.

Returns an XML representation of the parameters of a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object that are suitable to be included as subelements of an XMLDSIG `<Transform>` element.

A list of the XML nodes that represent the transform-specific content needed to describe the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object in an XMLDSIG `<Transform>` element.
Returns the output of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object
The output of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object.
Returns the output of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object as an object of the specified type.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform.GetOutput%2A> method returns the output of the current transform after it is run on the value previously set by a call to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform.LoadInput%2A> method.
The type of the returned object must be one of the type objects in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform.OutputTypes%2A> property.
The type of the output to return.
This must be one of the types in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform.OutputTypes"></xref> property.
The output of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object as an object of the specified type.
The type parameter is not a object.
-or-
The type parameter does not derive from a object.
Gets or sets a string that contains namespace prefixes to canonicalize using the standard canonicalization algorithm.

The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform.InclusiveNamespacesPrefixList%2A> property contains a whitespace-delimited list of namespace prefixes to canonicalize using the standard canonicalization algorithm rather than the exclusive canonicalization algorithm.
To specify the default namespace, which does not have a prefix, pass the special prefix "#default".
A string that contains namespace prefixes to canonicalize using the standard canonicalization algorithm.

Gets an array of types that are valid inputs to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform.LoadInput(System.Object)"></xref> method of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object.

The array returned by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform.InputTypes%2A> property must contain at least one element because every <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform> object must accept at least one type as valid input.

A <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform> object typically accepts one or more of the following types as input: <xref:System.IO.Stream>, <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument>, or <xref:System.Xml.XmlNodeList>.

An array of valid input types for the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object; you can pass only objects of one of these types to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform.LoadInput(System.Object)"></xref> method of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object.

Parses the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNodeList"></xref> object as transform-specific content of a `<Transform>` element and configures the internal state of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object to match the `<Transform>` element.
This method is used to process subelements of a `<Transform>` element.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNodeList"></xref> object that specifies transform-specific content for the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object.
When overridden in a derived class, loads the specified input into the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object.
The type of the input object must be one of the types in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform.InputTypes%2A> property.
The input to load into the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object.
The obj parameter is not a object.
-or-
The obj parameter is not an object.
-or-
The obj parameter is not an object.

Gets an array of types that are possible outputs from the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform.GetOutput"></xref> methods of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object.

The array returned by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform.OutputTypes%2A> property must contain at least one element because every transform must generate at least one type as output.

An array of valid output types for the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object; the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform.GetOutput*"></xref> methods of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigExcC14NTransform"></xref> object return only objects of one of these types.
